Mechanistically, T-705 is incorporated into newly synthesized RNA by the viral polymerase in place of purines but not pyrimidines,
95 resulting in increased frequencies of C-to-U and G-to-A transition mutations as demonstrated for influenza viruses and hepatitis C virus both in vitro and in vivo. 96, 97, 98 Collapse of virus replication is considered to be a consequence of error catastrophe or lethal mutagenesis, resulting from the accumulation of random low-frequency mutations in the viral genome ( Fig 2 ). The genetic barrier of T-705 against resistance is favorably high,
99 although a recent study has identified a pair of point mutations in the PB1 (K229R) and PA (P659L) polymerase subunits that reduce viral sensitivity to the compound by approximately 30-fold in cell culture.
